text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Olomouc Region | native_name = Olomoucký kraj | native_name_lang = | settlement_type = Region | image_skyline = Olomouc-Horní náměstí.JPG | image_caption = Olomouc | image_flag = Flag of Olomouc Region.svg | flag_size = | image_shield = Olomouc Region CoA CZ.svg | shield_size = | image_map = Olomoucký kraj in Czech Republic.svg | mapsize = | map_alt = | map_caption = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = Czech Republic | seat_type = Capital | seat = Olomouc | parts_type = Districts | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = (ANO) | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 5266.57 | elevation_m = | elevation_max_m = 1492 | elevation_min_m = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 632492 | population_as_of = 2019-01-01 | population_density_km2 = auto | iso_code = CZ-OL | registration_plate = M | website = www.kr-olomoucky.cz }} Olomouc Region is an administrative unit (kraj) of the Czech Republic. The capital city is Olomouc. The Jeseníky mountains are in the north of the region. The Morava river flows through the region. ==Administrative divisions== The Olomouc Region is divided into 5 districts: ==Places of interest== * Bouzov Castle * Hanakian region with its folkways, folklore shows and festivals that are organised in Náměšť, Prostějov, Kojetín, etc. * Helfštýn castle * Jánský vrch château ==References==
title: Olomouc Region
